intro: Erigeron tenuissimus, commonly known as slenderleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny areas such as prairies and rocky slopes. It features delicate, thread-like leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. Erigeron tenuissimus is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
